* Handles the generation and formatting of responses for user interactions.

*

The {@code Response} class provides methods to display introductory and outro messages,
* format responses based on user commands, and handle exceptions gracefully. It leverages
* various command classes ({@link MarkCommand}, {@link DeleteCommand}, {@link AddCommand})
* to execute user commands and generate appropriate responses.
* Generates and displays a response based on the user's input and the current task list.

*

This method determines the type of command (e.g., mark, delete, add) from the input
* and executes the corresponding command, handling any exceptions that occur.
* @param tasks The {@link TaskList} object containing the tasks to be modified or accessed.
public String generateResponse(String input, TaskList tasks) {
* Displays the introductory message when the TARS application starts.
\nGreetings, human! I'm TARS, your slightly sarcastic yet highly capable companion.
Let's get this chat started! Just remember, my humor setting is at 75%, so things might get a bit cheeky.""";
* Displays the outro message when the TARS application is about to exit.
Well, that's a wrap! If you need anything else, just holler.
But let’s be honest, you’re probably better off asking someone else.""";
* The main class for running the TARS application.

*

The {@code Tars} class handles the user interaction loop, allowing users to
* interact with the task management system by entering commands. It provides functionality
* to display introductory messages, process user input, execute commands, and save tasks
* Generates a response for the user's chat message.
* The main entry point for the TARS application.

* Executes the add command, adding a new task to the provided {@link TaskList}.

* An abstract class that represents a command to be executed on a {@link TaskList}.

*

The {@code Command} class serves as a base for all specific command types
* that can manipulate a {@link TaskList}. Each subclass must provide
* its own implementation of the {@link #execute(String, TaskList)} method to define
* the specific behavior of the command.
* Executes a command based on the given input and modifies the provided task list accordingly.
* @param input The input string representing the command to be executed.
* @param tasks The {@link TaskList} object containing the list of tasks to be modified or accessed.
* @return A {@link String} representing the result or response message after executing the command.
public abstract String execute(String input, TaskList tasks);
* Represents a command to delete an existing task from a {@link TaskList}.

*

The {@code DeleteCommand} class provides the functionality to remove a task
* from the {@link TaskList} based on user input. It extends the {@link Command} class
* and overrides the {@link Command#execute(String, TaskList)} method to implement
* the specific behavior for deleting a task.
* Executes the delete command, removing a specified task from the provided {@link TaskList}.
* @param input The input string representing the identifier or description of the task to be deleted.
* @param tasks The {@link TaskList} object from which the task will be deleted.
* @return A {@link String} message confirming the deletion of the task and showing the remaining number of tasks.
public String execute(String input, TaskList tasks) {
return String.format("Wow you're freeing yourself up\n   %s\nYou now have %s tasks left", t, tasks.noOfTasks());
* Represents a command to find tasks in the task list based on a description.
